alert.note: Alert for De Kalb (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 01 at 6:07PM CDT until July 01 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central Illinois and northeast Illinois, including the following areas, eastern DeKalb and western Kane counties. * WHEN...Until 915 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 605 PM CDT, doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elgin, St. Charles, Batavia, Geneva, Campton Hills, South Elgin, Elburn, Wayne, Valley View, Hinckley, Maple Park, Lily Lake, Kaneville and Virgil. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
